BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Naturally triggered avalanches in steep terrain, isolated snowdrift patches
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: From Hochschwab to Rax, low avalanche danger. But on steep slopes in all aspects, naturally triggered glide-snow/wet-snow avalanches are possible, releases mostly medium-sized. Open glide cracks are indicators of imminent danger. The forecast fresh snowfall and wind will generate furher isolated danger hones from snowdrift patches in estended east-facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack fundament is stable by and large, isolated persistent weak layer problems exist at high altitudes. Starting on Monday in the western sector of the Northern Alps and northern flank of Niedere Tauern, fresh snow up to 10 cm, transported by brisk NW winds into east/south aspects. Bonding adequate. On sunny slopes the snowpack is isotherm and moist, ion shady slopes the snowpack at high altitudes still has reserves of cold. On steep slopes with smooth ground the snowpack glides away. An area-wide snowpack exists only above the treeline.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Tuesday, slightly colder, variable in the northern regions, peaks of the Northern Alps often veiled in cloud, light snowfall, snowfall dropping from 1400 down to 1100 m. South of the Main Alpine Ridge only scattered clouds, it will remain dry. At 2000 m: -3 to -5 degrees. Brisk winds, in the northeastern ranges also at strong velocity from NW directions.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Wednesday, milder, winds shifting to westerly, mostly dry and sunny conditions. Fresh snowdrifts will settle and be less likely to trigger, the glide-snow problem will persist.

AvProblem.comment: possible at any time of day or night, at all altitudes

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Isolated glide-snow/wet-snow avalanches in steep terrain
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is generally low. On steep slopes in all aspects, isolated naturally triggered glide-snow and wet-snow avalanches can be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack fundament is stable, persistent weak layer on shady slopes. On sunny slopes the snowpack is isotherm and moist, on shady slopes at high altitudes there are still reserves of cold. In steep terrain on smooth ground the snowpack glides over the ground at high altitudes. An area-wide snowpack exists only above the treeline.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Tuesday, slightly colder, variable in the northern regions, peaks of the Northern Alps often veiled in cloud, light snowfall, snowfall dropping from 1400 down to 1100 m. South of the Main Alpine Ridge only scattered clouds, it will remain dry. At 2000 m: -3 to -5 degrees. Brisk winds, in the northeastern ranges also at strong velocity from NW directions.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Wednesday, milder, winds shifting to westerly, mostly dry and sunny conditions. Fresh snowdrifts will settle and be less likely to trigger, the glide-snow problem will persist.

AvProblem.comment: possible at any time of day or night in all aspects

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches in steep terrain and some snowdrifts on east-facing slopes
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Above the treeline moderate avalanche danger, below that altitude danger is low. Isolated danger zones occur from trigger-prone snowdrift accumulations on extended east-facing slopes. In addition, on steep slopes in all aspects naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches reaching medium-size can trigger. Open glide cracks are indicators of imminent danger.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack base is stable by and large, there is a persistent weak layer on some high-altitude slopes. Starting on Monday in the western sector or the Northern Alps and northern flank of the Niedere Tauern, fresh snow up to 20 cm, transported by brisk NW winds in eastern and southern aspects. Bonding generally good. On sunny slopes the snowpack is isotherm and moist, on shady slopes there are still reserves of cold. In steep terrain on smooth ground the snowpack glides downhill. An area-wide snowpack exists only above the treeline.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Tuesday, slightly colder, variable in the northern regions, peaks of the Northern Alps often veiled in cloud, light snowfall, snowfall dropping from 1400 down to 1100 m. South of the Main Alpine Ridge only scattered clouds, it will remain dry. At 2000 m: -3 to -5 degrees. Brisk winds, in the northeastern ranges also at strong velocity from NW directions.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Wednesday, milder, winds shifting to westerly, mostly dry and sunny conditions. Fresh snowdrifts will settle and be less likely to trigger, the glide-snow problem will persist.
